Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We've recently invested in a platform called Melt Water that will drive insights on what is being talked about and by what writers and contributors. We have several influencer databases that we've spent time developing relationships with. Once categorized, we've decided that we will also make this public to our community to help add to, or understand the level of engagement and activities are.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we will offer more transparency, which is something we've not focusing on as much in the past.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we've  made the decision to share more and not be in an endless "planning" and "perfecting loop that has often slowed down production output. we will share drafts under disclaimers and provide updates, whether they're formally announced or not. please also remember there are many items that are under NDA, where contractually we cannot disclose things until they've become finalized. we will however give high-level updates on status updates regarding these but won't disclose company/project names until allowed.

Author: dudezmobi#1945
Content: mornite peeps. thats niceeee

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We've been invited to be a founding member of a UN affiliated consultancy that is building a Blockchain Consortium group. This is an exciting opportunity for us, and will help give us credibility and validation as we pursue a nation-state blockchain solution that is a primary use case james has identified for our scaling solution.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We are also looking into leads for this proof of concept (POC) with 2 African countries, 2 asian cities, and one island.

Content: done we have a barterdex channel in products here at discord?

Author: dudezmobi#1945
Content: or we switching to hyperdex?

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: currently hyperdex is the main focus for the barterdex frontend, as decided by the technical team. we are aligned and will support any co-marketing activities that the hyperdex team needs.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we're in discussions with several projects on integrating barterdex to their front-ends. licensing of barterdex backend for liquidity providers is also being worked on.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: the business plan and structure needs to be finalized and ironed out before the marketing team can promote.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Someone mentioning in telegram about how to convince waves and erc20 tokens to move over to KMD. Obviously independent blockchains are a big factor, however does anyone think that providing your own mining power might be a turn off to many projects?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: obviously we can encourage them to use dPoW to help secure their chains, but they are likely to be under powered still, any thoughts on this?

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: There are efforts in creating solutions that will make ERC20 migrations more seamless. We haven't targeted waves at all, but they do have a targeted solution to create a token on their product that is  streamlined.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Yea I guess I'm just trying to figure out if we have a viable solution for ultra light, bordering on skeleton projects that have no desire for their own mining capabilities

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I guess PoS would be a suitable mining algo for barebone projects.
